query: How is Wolf different from Bear?
response: Wolves (Canis lupus) are members of the family Canidae, a “dog‑like” lineage within the suborder Caniformia, whereas bears belong to the family Ursidae, the “bear‑like” branch of the same suborder [[10]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caniformia).  An adult wolf typically weighs 70–130 lb (32–59 kg) and measures about 4–6 ft in length, while even the smallest bear species (e.g., the sun bear) exceeds a wolf’s mass, and large bears such as brown or polar bears can reach 350–680 kg [[9]](https://in

Wolf stands out because its AI security assistant (named Cipher or the AI Security Assistant) combines three rare strengths: decades‑long, human‑reinforced expertise, a platform‑wide data lake, and an open XDR architecture. The assistant is “enhanced by more than a decade of expert‑informed annotation from Arctic Wolf’s global SOC, leveraging millions of hours of human‑reinforced learning” to streamline investigations and drive more informed decisions [[1]](https://arcticwolf.com/resources/press
